intro: Tinnea coerulea, commonly known as the blue-tongued plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and emit a mild fragrance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tinnea coerulea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm climates.
